billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO INVESTIGATIONS AND GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS

title: Provides tax credit on personal income taxes for homeowner's insurance
summary: Provides a personal income tax credit of up to $350 for homeowners whose homeowner's insurance rate exceeds the mean of such rates in cities with a population of 100,000 or more; and requires the superintendent of insurance to annually compute the mean rate of premium charged per thousand for homeowner's and fire insurance.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the tax law, in relation to providing a credit for excessive residential insurance payments in certain cities
